programme.title: Tension at Table Rock
programme.desc: An outlaw (Richard Egan) on the run helps a sheriff (Cameron Mitchell) keep order in a town overrun by cowboys.

programme.title: Chino
programme.desc: A part-Indian rancher (Charles Bronson) hires a runaway (Vincent Van Patten) and loves a hostile rancher's sister (Jill Ireland) in 1880s New Mexico.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: An outlaw joins the Cartwrights' cattle drive, knowing it will take him to the town where his father is sheriff.

programme.title: The Gambler Wore a Gun
programme.desc: The new owner (Jim Davis) of a ranch has a problem with the deed, caused by a noose.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: A clumsy fortune-hunter doubles for a notorious gunfighter.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: An outlaw (Myron Healey) poses as a marshal in an attempt to free his brother from jail. With Paul McGuire, Gail Davis.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: After being framed and serving seven years in prison, a bitter man (Harry Lauter) returns to town. With Gail Davis.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie, Lofty and Tagg (Gail Davis, Brad Johnson, Jimmy Hawkins) step in when a store owner is killed and his young daughter is left blind. With Judy Nugent.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie becomes suspicious of Elaine Forbes, the seemingly innocent niece of a recently deceased rancher.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A visit to their old prospecting pal Speedy turns into a hunt for gold thieves when Hoppy and Lucky arrive in a troubled mining town.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Beset by a gang of thieves, strong-willed Crescent City freight boss Jane Travers enlists Hoppy and Lucky to help ferry a gold shipment across the Mexican border.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Eastern doctor's attempts to prevent a smallpox epidemic gets hampered.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: A fight for tolerance and brotherhood in San Francisco by Lord Charlie.

programme.title: Guns of Diablo
programme.desc: A wagon master is confronted by a man he wounded years before in episodes from "The Travels of Jaimie McPheeters.".

programme.title: Gun Glory
programme.desc: An ex-gunslinger (Stewart Granger) shunned by townsfolk is the only one who knows how to stop a ruthless cattleman.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas, Mark and Micah are taken prisoner by a group of bandits.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas, Mark and Micah escape from bandits and take refuge in a deserted building.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lou Mallory, a stunning redhead, arrives in North Fork and buys the hotel.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and several others are trapped in the hotel with a dangerous outlaw.

programme.title: Gold of the Seven Saints
programme.desc: Two trappers (Clint Walker, Roger Moore) are chased through treacherous terrain by bad guys who want their gold.

programme.title: Fort Dobbs
programme.desc: A wanted man (Clint Walker) leads a widow (Virginia Mayo) and her son to a fort away from Indians and a gunrunner (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Night of the Grizzly
programme.desc: A lawman (Clint Walker) turns rancher with his wife (Martha Hyer) and family, facing a bad neighbor (Keenan Wynn) and a bear killing livestock.
